Значения

Стул, сиденье

Мнемоника

Стул — для китайца странный 奇 деревянный 木 предмет.
purpleculture_pinyin:
yǐ
chair
стул
rtega_mnemonic:
椅椅RSchair, seat
  • a piece of wood 木 so unusually shaped 奇 one can sit on it
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 奇 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
椅子 [ yǐ zi ]: chair; Classifiers: 把
轮椅 [ lún yǐ ]: wheelchair
藤椅 [ téng yǐ ]: rattan chair
座椅 [ zuò yǐ ]: seat
躺椅 [ tǎng yǐ ]: deck chair; recliner; couch; lounge
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 奇 [ qí ] strange, unusual, odd; uncanny, occult
heisig_chinese_memo: To the Chinese, the first time they saw a chair, it looked like a strange use of wood! Probably why they still liked to sit on the floor...
heisig_constituent: chair, tree, wood, strange, large, St. Bernard, street, nail, spike, mouth
heisig_story: Instead of making a chair out of wood from a tree, this kanji has us making the whole tree into a chair, which looks most strange sitting in your living room where the sofa used to be.
koohiiStory1: To the Japanese, the first time they saw a chair, it looked like a strange use of wood! Probably why they still like to sit on the floor...
koohiiStory2: A strange kind of tree grows in the shape of a chair.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: This tree is very odd, to say the least. The shape is all crazy, like a lightning bolt stuck into the ground, or something. Oh wait, look at this. I can sit on it really nicely. It's just like a chair!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this odd tree chair being the most comfortable chair you've ever sat on. It's shaped perfectly for you, and the moss makes it soft. Wow, what a chair.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: But, this odd tree chair is also home to an eagle (い). It swoops down upon you as you sit down, gouging your eyes out.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel the fear and regret. You should have known not to sit in this "chair". Mother nature never forgives, and now you don't have eyeballs.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 亅 (зазубрина), 口 (рот), 大 (большой), 木 (дерево)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the strange (奇) tree (木) is used for a chair
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To the Chinese, the first time they saw a chair, it looked like a strange use of wood! Probably why they still liked to sit on the floor...
humanum_full_description_en:
From " wood " to " odd " sound. " Chair " is the name of wood, also known as Shantongzi, which is a deciduous tree. Wood can be made into utensils, and seeds can be squeezed into oil. "Said Wen": "Chair, Zi Ye. From wood, strange sound." "Compendium of Materia Medica. The second of wood. Arbors. "Catalpa": "There are many kinds of catalpas everywhere. There are three types: the white ones are the catalpa, the red ones are the catalpa, the beautiful ones of the catalpa are the chairs, and the small ones are the nuns." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Zhanlu": "Its Tong and its chair are actually Lili." Gao Heng's note: "Tong, Wutong. Chair, chair tree, namely mountain Tongzi." Song Yu of the Warring States Period "Gao Tang Fu": "Double chair hanging room, correct The stick will be there."

After " chair ", it often means chair. This is " reliant ", that is, a seat with a backrest. "Zhengzitong. Mube: "Chairs, there are people who lean behind the seat, and today they are called chairs." Such as "Zhu Zi Yu Lei." Li Seven. Sacrifice: "Ancient people sacrificed their sacrifices on the ground. For today's sacrifices, one chair and one table are required, and the wooden main chair is placed on the chair." Chapter 40 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "(Grandma Liu) Entering inside, I saw nothing but a pile Although I don’t recognize the surrounding screens, tables and chairs, large and small lanterns, I can only see the colorful display, each has its own wonder."
humanum_short_description_en: From " wood " to " odd " sound. " Chair " is originally a wooden name, but later it often means a chair, that is, a seat with a backrest.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「奇」聲。「椅」是木名，又稱山桐子，屬落葉喬木。木材可製器具，種子可榨油。《說文》：「椅，梓也。从木，奇聲。」《本草綱目．木之二．喬木類．梓》：「梓木處處有之。有三種：木理白者為梓，赤者為楸，梓之美文者為椅，楸之小者為榎。」如《詩．小雅．湛露》：「其桐其椅，其實離離。」高亨注：「桐，梧桐。椅，椅樹，即山桐子。」戰國宋玉〈高唐賦〉：「雙椅垂房，糾枝還會。」

　　「椅」後多表示椅子，本作「倚」，即有靠背可倚的坐具。《正字通．木部》：「椅，坐具後有倚者，今俗呼椅子。」如《朱子語類．禮七．祭》：「古人祭祀，只是席地。今祭祀時，須一椅一桌，木主置椅上。」《紅樓夢》第40回：「（劉姥姥）進裏面，只見烏壓壓的堆著些圍屏、桌椅、大小花燈之類，雖不大認得，只見五彩炫耀，各有奇妙。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「奇」聲。「椅」本為木名，後多表示椅子，即有靠背的坐具。

椅子(いす): chair

從「 木 」，「 奇 」聲。「 椅 」是木名，又稱山桐子，屬落葉喬木。木材可製器具，種子可榨油。《說文》：「椅，梓也。从木，奇聲。」《本草綱目．木之二．喬木類．梓》：「梓木處處有之。有三種：木理白者為梓，赤者為楸，梓之美文者為椅，楸之小者為榎。」如《詩．小雅．湛露》：「其桐其椅，其實離離。」高亨注：「桐，梧桐。椅，椅樹，即山桐子。」戰國宋玉〈高唐賦〉：「雙椅垂房，糾枝還會。」 「 椅 」後多表示椅子，本作「 倚 」，即有靠背可倚的坐具。《正字通．木部》：「椅，坐具後有倚者，今俗呼椅子。」如《朱子語類．禮七．祭》：「古人祭祀，只是席地。今祭祀時，須一椅一桌，木主置椅上。」《紅樓夢》第40回：「（劉姥姥）進裏面，只見烏壓壓的堆著些圍屏、桌椅、大小花燈之類，雖不大認得，只見五彩炫耀，各有奇妙。」
From " wood" to " odd" sound. " Chair" is the name of wood, also known as Shantongzi, which is a deciduous tree. Wood can be made into utensils, and seeds can be squeezed into oil. "Said Wen": "Chair, Zi Ye. From wood, strange sound." "Compendium of Materia Medica. The second of wood. Arbors. "Catalpa": "There are many kinds of catalpas everywhere. There are three types: the white ones are the catalpa, the red ones are the catalpa, the beautiful ones of the catalpa are the chairs, and the small ones are the nuns." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Zhanlu": "Its Tong and its chair are actually Lili." Gao Heng's note: "Tong, Wutong. Chair, chair tree, namely mountain Tongzi." Song Yu of the Warring States Period "Gao Tang Fu": "Double chair hanging room, correct The stick will be there." After " chair", it often means chair. This is " reliant", that is, a seat with a backrest. "Zhengzitong. Mube: "Chairs, there are people who lean behind the seat, and today they are called chairs." Such as "Zhu Zi Yu Lei." Li Seven. Sacrifice: "Ancient people sacrificed their sacrifices on the ground. For today's sacrifices, one chair and one table are required, and the wooden main chair is placed on the chair." Chapter 40 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "(Grandma Liu) Entering inside, I saw nothing but a pile Although I don’t recognize the surrounding screens, tables and chairs, large and small lanterns, I can only see the colorful display, each has its own wonder."

椅字的基本解释

椅
yǐ
有靠背的坐具：椅子。坐椅。木椅。躺椅。

椅
yī
落叶乔木，木材可以制器物。亦称“山桐子”。

椅字的汉语字典释义
椅字的康熙字典解释
椅字的源字形
椅字的起名意思

有靠背的坐具；[椅树]又叫"山桐子"。落叶乔木。夏天开黄绿色花。果实小，球形，红或红褐色。种子可榨油，供制肥皂或作润滑油。木材可制器物。

chair
Basic explanation of words
chair
yǐ
Seats with backrests: chairs. Chair. Wooden chair. Recliner.
chair
yī
Deciduous trees, wood can make utensils. Also known as "Mountain Tongzi".
chair
Chinese dictionary definition of words
chair
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
chair
Source glyph
chair
Name meaning
A seat with a backrest; [chair tree] is also called "Mountain Tongzi". Deciduous trees. Yellow-green flowers bloom in summer. The fruit is small, spherical, red or reddish brown. The seeds can be squeezed into oil for soap or lubricating oil. Wood can be used to make utensils.
yǐ, yī
сущ.
1) yǐ стул; кресло
桌椅 стол и стулья; мебель
2) yī бот. идезия многоплодная (Idesia polycarpa Maxim.)
Radicals: 木, 奇  (tree, odd)
Meaning Mnemonic
This tree is very odd, to say the least. The shape is all crazy, like a lightning bolt stuck into the ground, or something. Oh wait, look at this. I can sit on it really nicely. It's just like a chair!
Imagine this odd tree chair being the most comfortable chair you've ever sat on. It's shaped perfectly for you, and the moss makes it soft. Wow, what a chair.
Reading Mnemonic
But, this odd tree chair is also home to an eagle (い). It swoops down upon you as you sit down, gouging your eyes out.
Feel the fear and regret. You should have known not to sit in this "chair". Mother nature never forgives, and now you don't have eyeballs.
